newsitem.title: CANADA: Speedy files for US$125 mln notes offering.
newsitem.headline: Speedy files for US$125 mln notes offering.

text.p: Speedy Muffler King Inc said on Tuesday it filed a registration statement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission for a proposed public offering of US$125 million senior notes due 2006.
Speedy said the net proceeds from the offering would be used to repay most of the company's outstanding bank debt in North America and Europe.

The notes will be callable after five years but the company will be permitted to repay up to 35 percent of the outstanding notes if it completes an equity offering within the first three years, Speedy said.
It said the registration statement had not yet become effective and the notes had not been and would not be qualified for sale in Canada.
Speedy president and chief executive Hershell Ezrin said the offering was consistent with the financing objectives of the company.

"It will provide us with stable long-term financing," said Ezrin in a statement. "Furthermore, it will enable us to realign our obligations to better match the cash being generated by our North American and European operations."
